card.name: Abandoned Outpost
card.ability:
Abandoned Outpost enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Abandoned Outpost: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

card.name: Aboshan, Cephalid Emperor
card.ability:
Tap an untapped Cephalid you control: Tap target permanent.
{U}{U}{U}: Tap all creatures without flying.
card.flavor: "No one can fight the tide forever."

card.name: Aboshan's Desire
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.
Threshold — Enchanted creature has shroud as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

card.name: Acceptable Losses
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Acceptable Losses, discard a card at random.
Acceptable Losses deals 5 damage to target creature.

card.name: Aegis of Honor
card.ability: {1}: The next time an instant or sorcery spell would deal damage to you this turn, that spell deals that damage to its controller instead.

card.name: Æther Burst
card.ability: Return up to X target creatures to their owners' hands, where X is one plus the number of cards named Æther Burst in all graveyards as you cast Æther Burst.
card.flavor: As fleeting as a cephalid's promise.

card.name: Afflict
card.ability:
Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
Draw a card.
card.flavor: When one of the Patriarch's champions displeased him, he would only shake his finger. That was enough.

card.name: Amugaba
card.ability:
Flying
{2}{U}, Discard a card: Return Amugaba to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: The aven claim it feeds on thunder and rainbows.

card.name: Anarchist
card.ability: When Anarchist enters the battlefield, you may return target sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: Those who will not follow are doomed to lead.

card.name: Ancestral Tribute
card.ability:
You gain 2 life for each card in your graveyard.
Flashback {9}{W}{W}{W} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

card.name: Angelic Wall
card.ability: Defender, flying
card.flavor:
"The Ancestor protects us in ways we can't begin to comprehend."
—Mystic elder

card.name: Animal Boneyard
card.ability:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{T}, Sacrifice a creature: You gain life equal to that creature's toughness."
card.flavor:
"The animal spirits are the Ancestor's grandchildren. Remember them."
—Mystic elder

card.name: Ashen Firebeast
card.ability: {1}{R}: Ashen Firebeast deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.
card.flavor:
"I'm not sure which impresses me most, its thoroughness or its intensity."
—Matoc, lavamancer

card.name: Atogatog
card.ability: Sacrifice an Atog creature: Atogatog gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the sacrificed creature's power.
card.flavor: It relishes old-fashioned family meals.

card.name: Aura Graft
card.ability: Gain control of target Aura that's attached to a permanent. Attach it to another permanent it can enchant.
card.flavor: "It's not really stealing. It's more like extended borrowing."
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If there is no legal place to move the enchantment, then it doesn't move but you still control it.
7/15/2007 : Aura Graft's effect has no duration. You'll retain control of the Aura until the game ends, the Aura leaves the battlefield, or an effect causes someone else to gain control of the Aura.
7/15/2007 : You can target an Aura you already control just to move that Aura to a new permanent.

card.name: Auramancer
card.ability: When Auramancer enters the battlefield, you may return target enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: Beauty stirs the memory like a sweet perfume excites the air.

card.name: Aven Archer
card.ability:
Flying
{2}{W}, {T}: Aven Archer deals 2 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
card.flavor: Aimed by the eyes of eagles, their arrows never miss the mark.

card.name: Aven Cloudchaser
card.ability:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Aven Cloudchaser enters the battlefield, destroy target enchantment.
card.flavor:
"At the Reapportionment, Eagle begged to be human. The Ancestor granted half that prayer."
—Nomad myth

card.name: Aven Fisher
card.ability:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Aven Fisher dies, you may draw a card.
card.flavor: The same spears that catch their food today will defend their homes tomorrow.

card.name: Aven Flock
card.ability:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{W}: Aven Flock gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Just as each added feather steadies the wing, so does the flock grow stronger with each new member.

card.name: Aven Shrine
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a spell, that player gains X life, where X is the number of cards in all graveyards with the same name as that spell.

card.name: Aven Smokeweaver
card.ability: Flying, protection from red
card.flavor: In a world still pained from burns, some are born already scarred.

card.name: Aven Windreader
card.ability:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{1}{U}: Target player reveals the top card of his or her library.
card.flavor: "The tiniest ripple tells a story ten fathoms deep."

card.name: Balancing Act
card.ability: Each player chooses a number of permanents he or she controls equal to the number of permanents controlled by the player who controls the fewest, then sacrifices the rest. Each player discards cards the same way.

card.name: Balshan Beguiler
card.ability: Whenever Balshan Beguiler deals combat damage to a player, that player reveals the top two cards of his or her library. You choose one of those cards and put it into his or her graveyard.

card.name: Balshan Griffin
card.ability:
Flying
{1}{U}, Discard a card: Return Balshan Griffin to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: It helps to have an extra direction in which to run.

card.name: Bamboozle
card.ability: Target player reveals the top four cards of his or her library. You choose two of those cards and put them into his or her graveyard. Put the rest on top of his or her library in any order.

card.name: Barbarian Lunatic
card.ability: {2}{R}, Sacrifice Barbarian Lunatic: Barbarian Lunatic deals 2 damage to target creature.
card.flavor:
"I once saw a single barbarian charge a band of twenty nomads. I've seen some crazy ones, too."
—Nomad sentry

card.name: Barbarian Ring
card.ability:
{T}: Add {R} to your mana pool. Barbarian Ring deals 1 damage to you.
Threshold — {R}, {T}, Sacrifice Barbarian Ring: Barbarian Ring deals 2 damage to target creature or player. Activate this ability only if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

card.name: Bash to Bits
card.ability:
Destroy target artifact.
Flashback {4}{R}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

card.name: Battle of Wits
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have 200 or more cards in your library, you win the game.
card.flavor: The wizard who reads a thousand books is powerful. The wizard who memorizes a thousand books is insane.
card.ruling:
7/1/2012 : Battle of Wits has an "intervening 'if' clause." This means that if you don't have 200 or more cards in your library at the beginning of your upkeep, the ability won't trigger. If the ability does trigger, but you have fewer than 200 cards in your library when the ability resolves, the ability will do nothing.
7/1/2012 : In tournaments, you must be able to shuffle your entire deck within a reasonable amount of time.

card.name: Battle Strain
card.ability: Whenever a creature blocks, Battle Strain deals 1 damage to that creature's controller.
card.flavor: The pits swallow the weak as predators swallow prey.

card.name: Bearscape
card.ability: {1}{G}, Exile two cards from your graveyard: Put a 2/2 green Bear creature token onto the battlefield.
card.flavor:
"Nature is the endless dance between life and death."
—Seton, centaur druid

card.name: Beast Attack
card.ability:
Put a 4/4 green Beast creature token onto the battlefield.
Flashback {2}{G}{G}{G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

card.name: Beloved Chaplain
card.ability: Protection from creatures
card.flavor: Nomad and Nantuko, eagle and elephant; all the birds and beasts are charmed by his quiet dignity.

card.name: Blazing Salvo
card.ability: Blazing Salvo deals 3 damage to target creature unless that creature's controller has Blazing Salvo deal 5 damage to him or her.
card.flavor: Barbarians equate courage with the ability to endure pain.

card.name: Blessed Orator
card.ability: Other creatures you control get +0/+1.
card.flavor: His quiet words fade into the night's chill, yet they burn into his listeners' minds with all the power of a thousand suns.

card.name: Bloodcurdler
card.ability:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, put the top card of your library into your graveyard.
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Bloodcurdler gets +1/+1 and has "At the beginning of your end step, exile two cards from your graveyard."

card.name: Bog Wreckage
card.ability:
Bog Wreckage enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Bog Wreckage: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

card.name: Bomb Squad
card.ability:
{T}: Put a fuse counter on target creature.
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a fuse counter on each creature with a fuse counter on it.
Whenever a creature has four or more fuse counters on it, remove all fuse counters from it and destroy it. That creature deals 4 damage to its controller.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If the creature regenerates, the fuse counters are still removed and the four damage is still dealt.
10/4/2004 : If there are two Bomb Squads on the battlefield when a creature ends up with 4 or more fuse counters, both Bomb Squad abilities will trigger causing 4 damage each even though the first to resolve will destroy the creature.

card.name: Braids, Cabal Minion
card.ability: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices an artifact, creature, or land.
card.flavor: "Home is where you can find a decent graveyard and strangers can disappear without awkward questions."

card.name: Buried Alive
card.ability: Search your library for up to three creature cards and put them into your graveyard. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: The scrape of shovels and the tumble of cold dirt soon muffled their pleas.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You can look in your library and then choose to find any number from zero to three creatures after you look at it.

card.name: Burning Sands
card.ability: Whenever a creature dies, that creature's controller sacrifices a land.
card.flavor:
"Pain teaches lessons no scholar can."
—Kamahl, pit fighter

card.name: Cabal Inquisitor
card.ability: Threshold — {1}{B}, {T}, Exile two cards from your graveyard: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery, and only if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

card.name: Cabal Patriarch
card.ability:
{2}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
{2}{B}, Exile a creature card from your graveyard: Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.

card.name: Cabal Pit
card.ability:
{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool. Cabal Pit deals 1 damage to you.
Threshold — {B}, {T}, Sacrifice Cabal Pit: Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

card.name: Cabal Shrine
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a spell, that player discards X cards, where X is the number of cards in all graveyards with the same name as that spell.

card.name: Call of the Herd
card.ability:
Put a 3/3 green Elephant creature token onto the battlefield.
Flashback {3}{G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

card.name: Cantivore
card.ability:
Vigilance
Cantivore's power and toughness are each equal to the number of enchantment cards in all graveyards.

card.name: Careful Study
card.ability: Draw two cards, then discard two cards.
card.flavor: Books are like crops—they must be thinned for best yield.

card.name: Cartographer
card.ability: When Cartographer enters the battlefield, you may return target land card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: "Finding the way once is luck. Finding the way twice takes a good map."

card.name: Catalyst Stone
card.ability:
Flashback costs you pay cost up to {2} less.
Flashback costs your opponents pay cost {2} more.
card.flavor: The gems' incandescence invades the dreams of all who see them.

card.name: Caustic Tar
card.ability:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{T}: Target player loses 3 life."
card.flavor:
"Twisted magic, twisted fate,
Force the land to ooze with hate."
—Cabal chant

card.name: Cease-Fire
card.ability:
Target player can't cast creature spells this turn.
Draw a card.
card.flavor: When the crimson fades from the magical embers, a final wisp of smoke will rise. Soon after, hostilities will begin anew.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This spell will not counter any creature spells on the stack. It only prevents new creature spells from being cast after it resolves.

card.name: Centaur Garden
card.ability:
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool. Centaur Garden deals 1 damage to you.
Threshold — {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Centaur Garden: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn. Activate this ability only if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

card.name: Cephalid Broker
card.ability: {T}: Target player draws two cards, then discards two cards.
card.flavor: Cephalids value the free exchange of ideas—except for the "free" part.

card.name: Cephalid Coliseum
card.ability:
{T}: Add {U} to your mana pool. Cephalid Coliseum deals 1 damage to you.
Threshold — {U}, {T}, Sacrifice Cephalid Coliseum: Target player draws three cards, then discards three cards. Activate this ability only if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

card.name: Cephalid Looter
card.ability: {T}: Target player draws a card, then discards a card.
card.flavor: "Amazing, isn't it, what humans will throw away when they're drowning?"

card.name: Cephalid Retainer
card.ability: {U}{U}: Tap target creature without flying.
card.flavor: Cephalids whisper flattery in your ear, put jewels in your hand, spin dreams in your head, and stick knives in your back.

card.name: Cephalid Scout
card.ability:
Flying
{2}{U}, Sacrifice a land: Draw a card.
card.flavor: The more they survey the dreadful dry expanses, the more the cephalids thirst to tame them.

card.name: Cephalid Shrine
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a spell, counter that spell unless that player pays {X}, where X is the number of cards in all graveyards with the same name as the spell.

card.name: Chainflinger
card.ability:
{1}{R}, {T}: Chainflinger deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
Threshold — {2}{R}, {T}: Chainflinger deals 2 damage to target creature or player. Activate this ability only if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

card.name: Chamber of Manipulation
card.ability:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{T}, Discard a card: Gain control of target creature until end of turn."
card.flavor: Politics is just a subtle form of mind control—and cephalids are master politicians.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Remember that the creature does not gain Haste, so you can't attack with that creature or use any ability with {T} in the activation cost during the turn you take control of it.
10/4/2004 : The creature does not untap if it is tapped.

card.name: Chance Encounter
card.ability:
Whenever you win a coin flip, put a luck counter on Chance Encounter.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Chance Encounter has ten or more luck counters on it, you win the game.
card.flavor: The more unlikely the victory, the more memorable the success.
card.ruling: 2/1/2009 : You can only win a coin flip if you are the player flipping the coin. Your opponent losing a flip does not count as you winning one. This is a reversal of previous rulings.

card.name: Charmed Pendant
card.ability: {T}, Put the top card of your library into your graveyard: For each colored mana symbol in that card's mana cost, add one mana of that color to your mana pool. Activate this ability only any time you could cast an instant. (For example, if the card's mana cost is {3}{U}{U}{B}, you add {U}{U}{B} to your mana pool.)
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The ability is still a mana ability (and doesn't use the stack) even though you can only activate it when you could cast an Instant.
11/1/2005 : If you flip over a hybrid card, you get one of either color mana, not both, for each mana symbol.

card.name: Chatter of the Squirrel
card.ability:
Put a 1/1 green Squirrel creature token onto the battlefield.
Flashback {1}{G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

card.name: Childhood Horror
card.ability:
Flying
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Childhood Horror gets +2/+2 and can't block.

card.name: Chlorophant
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Chlorophant.
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Chlorophant has "At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put another +1/+1 counter on Chlorophant."

card.name: Coffin Purge
card.ability:
Exile target card from a graveyard.
Flashback {B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

card.name: Cognivore
card.ability:
Flying
Cognivore's power and toughness are each equal to the number of instant cards in all graveyards.

card.name: Concentrate
card.ability: Draw three cards.
card.flavor: "The treasure in my mind is greater than any worldly glory."

card.name: Confessor
card.ability: Whenever a player discards a card, you may gain 1 life.
card.flavor: "There will be gains for our losses. There will be rights for our wrongs."

card.name: Crashing Centaur
card.ability:
{G}, Discard a card: Crashing Centaur gains trample until end of turn.
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Crashing Centaur gets +2/+2 and has shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

card.name: Crypt Creeper
card.ability: Sacrifice Crypt Creeper: Exile target card from a graveyard.
card.flavor: To unearth its dinner, it inters itself.
card.ruling: 5/1/2012 : You must be able to target a card in a graveyard to activate Crypt Creeper's ability. It can't target itself.

card.name: Crystal Quarry
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{5}, {T}: Add {W}{U}{B}{R}{G} to your mana pool.
card.flavor:
"How tragic that greed eclipses beauty."
—Seton, centaur druid

card.name: Cultural Exchange
card.ability: Choose any number of creatures target player controls. Choose the same number of creatures another target player controls. Those players exchange control of those creatures. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

card.name: Cursed Monstrosity
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Cursed Monstrosity becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it unless you discard a land card.
card.flavor:
"Run away It's an . . . um . . . run away"
—Nomad sentry

card.name: Darkwater Catacombs
card.ability: {1}, {T}: Add {U}{B} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Murky Otarian tides hide the forgotten treacheries of the Phyrexian war.

card.name: Darkwater Egg
card.ability: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Darkwater Egg: Add {U}{B} to your mana pool. Draw a card.
card.flavor:
"Do you thirst for knowledge no matter the cost?"
—Watnik, master glassblower
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : This is a mana ability, which means it can be activated as part of the process of casting a spell or activating another ability. If that happens you get the mana right away, but you don't get to look at the drawn card until you have finished casting that spell or activating that ability.

card.name: Decaying Soil
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, exile a card from your graveyard.
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Decaying Soil has "Whenever a nontoken creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may pay {1}. If you do, return that card to your hand."
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Multiple creatures going to the graveyard at the same time all end up there at once, so either all of them or none of them will cause the trigger to go off, depending on whether or not Threshold was met prior to the creatures going to the graveyard.
10/4/2004 : The ability in Threshold will trigger only if Threshold was met before the creature goes to the graveyard. So the one that causes Threshold to be met will not trigger the ability.

card.name: Decimate
card.ability: Destroy target artifact, target creature, target enchantment, and target land.
card.flavor:
"Anyone can admire creation. Only a barbarian sees the beauty in demolition."
—Kamahl, pit fighter
card.ruling: 12/1/2004 : You no longer need four distinct targets for Decimate.  If the spell or ability uses the word target in multiple places, the same object or player can be chosen once for each instance of the word "target." For example, you could choose Tree of Tales for both the artifact and the land. You still need a legal target enchantment and creature as well.

card.name: Decompose
card.ability: Exile up to three target cards from a single graveyard.
card.flavor:
"Sheesh How am I supposed to make a decent living around here?"
—Cabal grave robber

card.name: Dedicated Martyr
card.ability: {W}, Sacrifice Dedicated Martyr: You gain 3 life.
card.flavor:
"If he's so willing to suffer for his cause, then by all means, let us oblige him."
—Cabal Patriarch

card.name: Deep Reconnaissance
card.ability:
Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
Flashback {4}{G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

card.name: Delaying Shield
card.ability:
If damage would be dealt to you, put that many delay counters on Delaying Shield instead.
At the beginning of your upkeep, remove all delay counters from Delaying Shield. For each delay counter removed this way, you lose 1 life unless you pay {1}{W}.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Note that the damage is replaced and is not "prevented". This means it can replace damage that "can't be prevented".

card.name: Deluge
card.ability: Tap all creatures without flying.
card.flavor:
"From the sea came all life, and to the sea it will return. The sooner the better."
—Emperor Aboshan

card.name: Dematerialize
card.ability:
Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
Flashback {5}{U}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

card.name: Demolish
card.ability: Destroy target artifact or land.
card.flavor:
"Pound the steel until it fits.
Doesn't work? Bash to bits."
—Dwarven forging song

card.name: Demoralize
card.ability:
Each creature can't be blocked this turn except by two or more creatures.
Threshold — If seven or more cards are in your graveyard, creatures can't block this turn.

card.name: Deserted Temple
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}: Untap target land.
card.flavor: A monument to long-forgotten gods, it stands as a tribute to the fleeting nature of human ways.

card.name: Devoted Caretaker
card.ability: {W}, {T}: Target permanent you control gains protection from instant spells and from sorcery spells until end of turn.
card.flavor: Her eyes blaze with the strength of twenty shields. Every glance is a salvation.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The permanent affected by this ability can't be targeted by Instant and Sorcery spells and (if it's a creature) all damage from Instant and Sorcery spells will be prevented.

card.name: Diabolic Tutor
card.ability: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: The best ideas often come from the worst minds.

card.name: Diligent Farmhand
card.ability:
{1}{G}, Sacrifice Diligent Farmhand: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
If Diligent Farmhand is in a graveyard, effects from spells named Muscle Burst count it as a card named Muscle Burst.

card.name: Dirty Wererat
card.ability:
{B}, Discard a card: Regenerate Dirty Wererat.
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Dirty Wererat gets +2/+2 and can't block.

card.name: Divert
card.ability: Change the target of target spell with a single target unless that spell's controller pays {2}.
card.flavor: "What's the fun of being a wizard if you can't mess with people's heads?"

card.name: Divine Sacrament
card.ability:
White creatures get +1/+1.
Threshold — White creatures get an additional +1/+1 as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
card.flavor: Their whispered prayers rally the nomads better than any war cry could.

card.name: Dogged Hunter
card.ability: {T}: Destroy target creature token.
card.flavor: The relationship between hunter and hunted knows nothing of alliances.

card.name: Dreamwinder
card.ability:
Dreamwinder can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
{U}, Sacrifice an Island: Target land becomes an Island until end of turn.

card.name: Druid Lyrist
card.ability: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Druid Lyrist: Destroy target enchantment.
card.flavor: The druids and the forest are in perfect harmony. They sing the same songs.

card.name: Druid's Call
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature is dealt damage, its controller puts that many 1/1 green Squirrel creature tokens onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: Suffer the little creatures, for they may yet rise up and beat you senseless.

card.name: Dusk Imp
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: It despises humans and squirrels and beasts and dwarves and cephalids . . .well, it despises just about everything.

card.name: Dwarven Grunt
card.ability: Mountainwalk
card.flavor:
Hard as stone and twice as stubborn.
—Dwarven compliment

card.name: Dwarven Recruiter
card.ability: When Dwarven Recruiter enters the battlefield, search your library for any number of Dwarf cards and reveal those cards. Shuffle your library, then put them on top of it in any order.

card.name: Dwarven Shrine
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a spell, Dwarven Shrine deals X damage to that player, where X is twice the number of cards in all graveyards with the same name as that spell.

card.name: Dwarven Strike Force
card.ability: Discard a card at random: Dwarven Strike Force gains first strike and haste until end of turn.
card.flavor: Any given foothill may hide dozens of dwarves waiting to spill from their tunnels like fire ants.

card.name: Earnest Fellowship
card.ability: Each creature has protection from its colors.
card.flavor:
"The world has enough strife as it is. Where would we be if we turned against each other?"
—Pianna, nomad captain
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : A creature with no color does not gain any Protection ability.

card.name: Earth Rift
card.ability:
Destroy target land.
Flashback {5}{R}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

card.name: Elephant Ambush
card.ability:
Put a 3/3 green Elephant creature token onto the battlefield.
Flashback {6}{G}{G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

card.name: Ember Beast
card.ability: Ember Beast can't attack or block alone.
card.flavor:
Spot one ember beast, attack.
Spot a second, best fall back.
—Dwarven saying
card.ruling:
1/24/2013 : Ember Beast can’t attack or block unless another creature is also assigned to attack or block at the same time. Notably, two Ember Beasts can attack or block together.
1/24/2013 : Once Ember Beast has been declared as an attacker or blocker, it doesn’t matter what happens to the other creature(s).
1/24/2013 : Other creatures assigned to attack alongside Ember Beast don’t have to attack the same player or planeswalker. Other creatures assigned to block alongside Ember Beast don’t have to block the same creature as Ember Beast.

card.name: Embolden
card.ability:
Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt this turn to any number of target creatures and/or players, divided as you choose.
Flashback {1}{W} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You can't choose zero targets. You must choose at least one target.

card.name: Engulfing Flames
card.ability:
Engulfing Flames deals 1 damage to target creature. It can't be regenerated this turn.
Flashback {3}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

card.name: Entomb
card.ability: Search your library for a card and put that card into your graveyard. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: A grave is the safest place to store ill-gotten treasures.

card.name: Epicenter
card.ability:
Target player sacrifices a land.
Threshold — Each player sacrifices all lands he or she controls instead if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
card.flavor: Sometimes destruction is Dominaria's way of rebuilding. Sometimes it's not.

card.name: Escape Artist
card.ability:
Escape Artist is unblockable.
{U}, Discard a card: Return Escape Artist to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: "Not even my shadow knows where I am."

card.name: Execute
card.ability:
Destroy target white creature. It can't be regenerated.
Draw a card.
card.flavor:
"Any fool who would die for honor is better off dead."
—Cabal Patriarch

card.name: Extract
card.ability: Search target player's library for a card and exile it. Then that player shuffles his or her library.
card.flavor: To say Nixar had a splitting headache would be a bit of an understatement.

card.name: Face of Fear
card.ability: {2}{B}, Discard a card: Face of Fear gains fear until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
card.flavor:
"It's only frightened five people to death. Not my best work."
—Braids, dementia summoner

card.name: Famished Ghoul
card.ability: {1}{B}, Sacrifice Famished Ghoul: Exile up to two target cards from a single graveyard.
card.flavor: Memories have distinct tastes. Its favorites are the sickly sweetness of lost love and the bitter smokiness of cruel murder.

card.name: Fervent Denial
card.ability:
Counter target spell.
Flashback {5}{U}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.flavor:
"Your tenacity is admirable. And futile."
—Emperor Aboshan

card.name: Filthy Cur
card.ability: Whenever Filthy Cur is dealt damage, you lose that much life.
card.flavor: Some things even fleas won't bite.

card.name: Firebolt
card.ability:
Firebolt deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
Flashback {4}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.flavor: Reach out and torch someone.

card.name: Flame Burst
card.ability: Flame Burst deals X damage to target creature or player, where X is 2 plus the number of cards named Flame Burst in all graveyards.
card.flavor: As hot as a dwarf's rage.

card.name: Fledgling Imp
card.ability: {B}, Discard a card: Fledgling Imp gains flying until end of turn.
card.flavor: Imps aren't born knowing how to fly—just how to annoy.

card.name: Frenetic Ogre
card.ability: {R}, Discard a card at random: Frenetic Ogre gets +3/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: The best thing about ogres is that they never try to sneak up on you.

card.name: Frightcrawler
card.ability:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Frightcrawler gets +2/+2 and can't block.

card.name: Gallantry
card.ability:
Target blocking creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
Draw a card.
card.flavor: The courageous accomplish more in a single moment than the cowardly do in a lifetime.

card.name: Ghastly Demise
card.ability: Destroy target nonblack creature if its toughness is less than or equal to the number of cards in your graveyard.
card.flavor:
"Anyone can snap her fingers and yank a soul. I prefer to kill creatively."
—Braids, dementia summoner
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This card is not in the graveyard until after you destroy the creatures. So it does not count itself when determining the maximum toughness.

card.name: Gorilla Titan
card.ability:
Trample
Gorilla Titan gets +4/+4 as long as there are no cards in your graveyard.
card.flavor: "I want a banana this big"

card.name: Graceful Antelope
card.ability:
Plainswalk
Whenever Graceful Antelope deals combat damage to a player, you may have target land become a Plains until Graceful Antelope leaves the battlefield.

card.name: Gravedigger
card.ability: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: Oddly, no one questioned the Cabal's wisdom in hiring a zombie to work at the cemetery.
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

card.name: Gravestorm
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, target opponent may exile a card from his or her graveyard. If that player doesn't, you may draw a card.

card.name: Ground Seal
card.ability:
When Ground Seal enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Cards in graveyards can't be the targets of spells or abilities.
card.flavor:
"Let all we have buried be buried forever."
—Seton, centaur druid
card.ruling:
7/1/2012 : The last ability only works when Ground Seal is on the battlefield.
7/1/2012 : Only spells and abilities that target cards in graveyards will be affected. Abilities that don't target cards in graveyards (like the one Tormod's Crypt has) can still affect those cards.

card.name: Halberdier
card.ability: First strike
card.flavor: His reputation precedes him—and so does his weapon.

card.name: Hallowed Healer
card.ability:
{T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
Threshold — {T}: Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn. Activate this ability only if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

card.name: Haunting Echoes
card.ability: Exile all cards from target player's graveyard other than basic land cards. For each card exiled this way, search that player's library for all cards with the same name as that card and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : While you're searching the player's library, you don't have to find all the cards with the same name as an exiled card if you don't want to. You can leave any number of them in that player's library

card.name: Hint of Insanity
card.ability: Target player reveals his or her hand. That player discards all nonland cards with the same name as another card in his or her hand.
card.flavor: "Practice makes perfect, but obsession makes better."

card.name: Holistic Wisdom
card.ability: {2}, Exile a card from your hand: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand if it shares a card type with the card exiled this way. (Artifact, creature, enchantment, instant, land, planeswalker, sorcery, and tribal are card types.)

card.name: Howling Gale
card.ability:
Howling Gale deals 1 damage to each creature with flying and each player.
Flashback {1}{G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

card.name: Immobilizing Ink
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
Enchanted creature has "{1}, Discard a card: Untap this creature."

card.name: Impulsive Maneuvers
card.ability: Whenever a creature attacks, flip a coin. If you win the flip, the next time that creature would deal combat damage this turn, it deals double that damage instead. If you lose the flip, the next time that creature would deal combat damage this turn, prevent that damage.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You flip a coin for each creature that attacks, not once per attack.

card.name: Infected Vermin
card.ability:
{2}{B}: Infected Vermin deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.
Threshold — {3}{B}: Infected Vermin deals 3 damage to each creature and each player. Activate this ability only if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

card.name: Innocent Blood
card.ability: Each player sacrifices a creature.
card.flavor: Zombies mourn for the living and celebrate those who will soon be given the gift of death.

card.name: Iridescent Angel
card.ability: Flying, protection from all colors
card.flavor: She enraptures all, encompasses all, endures all.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This card has Protection from Black, from Blue, from Red, from White, and from Green. This is the definition of "All Colors". This means it is possible to use an effect that removes one color of protection, such as just black, on this card.

card.name: Ivy Elemental
card.ability: Ivy Elemental enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
card.flavor: In the gardens of the centaurs, many travelers have mysteriously vanished while admiring the elaborate topiaries.

card.name: Junk Golem
card.ability:
Junk Golem enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Junk Golem unless you remove a +1/+1 counter from it.
{1}, Discard a card: Put a +1/+1 counter on Junk Golem.

card.name: Kamahl, Pit Fighter
card.ability:
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
{T}: Kamahl, Pit Fighter deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: "I didn't come to play. I came to win."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The Legend rule only applies to two Legends with identical names. If the names are similar, but different, the rule does not apply.

card.name: Kamahl's Desire
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has first strike.
Threshold — Enchanted creature gets +3/+0 as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

card.name: Karmic Justice
card.ability: Whenever a spell or ability an opponent controls destroys a noncreature permanent you control, you may destroy target permanent that opponent controls.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : A spell or ability that asks for a sacrifice will not trigger this card.
10/4/2004 : If an opponent destroys Karmic Justice, it will trigger on its own destruction.
10/4/2004 : Karmic Justice will not trigger off of its ability destroying a permanent since you destroy the permanent and you are not one of your opponents.
10/4/2004 : Karmic Justice will not trigger if an opponent's spell or ability causes your permanent to be destroyed indirectly. For example, if the spell caused an ability you control to trigger, and thereby destroy your permanent.

card.name: Kirtar's Desire
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack.
Threshold — Enchanted creature can't block as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

card.name: Kirtar's Wrath
card.ability:
Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.
Threshold — If seven or more cards are in your graveyard, instead destroy all creatures, then put two 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield. Creatures destroyed this way can't be regenerated.

card.name: Krosan Archer
card.ability:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
{G}, Discard a card: Krosan Archer gets +0/+2 until end of turn.

card.name: Krosan Avenger
card.ability:
Trample
Threshold — {1}{G}: Regenerate Krosan Avenger. Activate this ability only if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
card.flavor: She'd have a fearsome reputation if she left any survivors.

card.name: Krosan Beast
card.ability: Threshold — Krosan Beast gets +7/+7 as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
card.flavor: Those who see the squirrels go underground in the winter aren't ready for what emerges in the spring.

card.name: Laquatus's Creativity
card.ability: Target player draws cards equal to the number of cards in his or her hand, then discards that many cards.
card.flavor: One never knows when inspiration will bubble up.

card.name: Last Rites
card.ability: Discard any number of cards. Target player reveals his or her hand, then you choose a nonland card from it for each card discarded this way. That player discards those cards.

card.name: Lava Blister
card.ability: Destroy target nonbasic land unless its controller has Lava Blister deal 6 damage to him or her.
card.flavor:
To treat flesh wounds, use earth. To treat earth wounds, use flesh.
—Barbarian saying

card.name: Leaf Dancer
card.ability: Forestwalk
card.flavor: A leaf dancer sweeps through the forest like a spring breeze, evading even the sharpest eyes and ears.

card.name: Lieutenant Kirtar
card.ability:
Flying
{1}{W}, Sacrifice Lieutenant Kirtar: Exile target attacking creature.
card.flavor:
"His strengths are pride, devotion, and ambition. His weaknesses are the same."
—Pianna, nomad captain

card.name: Life Burst
card.ability: Target player gains 4 life, then gains 4 life for each card named Life Burst in each graveyard.
card.flavor: As uplifting as a mystic's dreams.

card.name: Limestone Golem
card.ability: {2}, Sacrifice Limestone Golem: Target player draws a card.
card.flavor: Dwarves have been known to take pickaxes to their own creations, hoping to discover treasures within.

card.name: Liquid Fire
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Liquid Fire, choose a number between 0 and 5.
Liquid Fire deals X damage to target creature and 5 minus X damage to that creature's controller, where X is the chosen number.
card.flavor: There's no such thing as a little bit of lava.
card.ruling: 5/1/2009 : You choose the number as you cast the spell. If you choose 0, the creature's controller will be dealt 5 damage. If you choose 5, that player will not be dealt any damage.

card.name: Lithatog
card.ability:
Sacrifice an artifact: Lithatog gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Sacrifice a land: Lithatog gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

card.name: Luminous Guardian
card.ability:
{W}: Luminous Guardian gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
{2}: Luminous Guardian can block an additional creature this turn.
card.flavor: "There is no victory without virtue."

card.name: Mad Dog
card.ability: At the beginning of your end step, if Mad Dog didn't attack or come under your control this turn, sacrifice it.
card.flavor: The bones it buries may be yours.

card.name: Magma Vein
card.ability: {R}, Sacrifice a land: Magma Vein deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.
card.flavor:
Standing near a volcano
—Barbarian expression meaning
"asking for it"

card.name: Magnivore
card.ability:
Haste (This creature can attack the turn it comes under your control.)
Magnivore's power and toughness are each equal to the number of sorcery cards in all graveyards.

card.name: Malevolent Awakening
card.ability: {1}{B}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: The most popular pit fighters are brought back for encore performances.

card.name: Master Apothecary
card.ability: Tap an untapped Cleric you control: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
card.flavor: It takes a remarkable cleric to turn a group of healers into a hospital.

card.name: Metamorphic Wurm
card.ability: Threshold — Metamorphic Wurm gets +4/+4 as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
card.flavor: Only a handful have seen it transform. Or, from the wurm's perspective, only a mouthful.

card.name: Millikin
card.ability: {T}, Put the top card of your library into your graveyard: Add {1} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: The toymaker frowned in bewilderment. None of his creations had ever sneezed before.

card.name: Mind Burst
card.ability: Target player discards X cards, where X is one plus the number of cards named Mind Burst in all graveyards.
card.flavor: As haunting as a zombie's curse.

card.name: Mindslicer
card.ability: When Mindslicer dies, each player discards his or her hand.
card.flavor: It is the thing that goes bump in the night.

card.name: Mine Layer
card.ability:
{1}{R}, {T}: Put a mine counter on target land.
Whenever a land with a mine counter on it becomes tapped, destroy it.
When Mine Layer leaves the battlefield, remove all mine counters from all lands.

card.name: Minotaur Explorer
card.ability: When Minotaur Explorer enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard a card at random.
card.flavor: After the invasion devastated the Talruum and Hurloon tribes, the survivors began to search for other minotaurs.

card.name: Mirari
card.ability: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, you may pay {3}. If you do, copy that spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.
card.flavor:
"It offers you what you want, not what you need."
—Braids, dementia summoner
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Everything about the original spell is copied, including any decisions made on announcement, such as whether it was kicked or its Buyback cost was paid. Effects on the spell, such as Sleight of Mind or Flashback, are not copied.
10/4/2004 : If the copied spell requires a target and there are no legal targets, then the copy has the same target (which should be illegal) as the original.
10/4/2004 : If the spell is countered before the triggered ability resolves, then the ability will make a copy of how the spell looked right before it was countered.
10/4/2004 : It triggers once per spell, so you can't get multiple copies of a spell using this card. And since this card is Legendary, you can't have more than one on the battlefield.
10/4/2004 : The copy is not "cast" so it will not trigger anything that triggers on a spell being cast.
10/4/2004 : You choose whether or not to pay when the triggered ability resolves.
10/4/2004 : You are not required to choose new targets. If you do choose, then the targets must be legal. If you don't change them, the spell is placed on the stack whether or not the targets are legal. The legality of the targets is always checked on resolution of the spell, so the spell may be countered at that time if all of its targets are illegal.

card.name: Molten Influence
card.ability: Counter target instant or sorcery spell unless its controller has Molten Influence deal 4 damage to him or her.
card.flavor: Lavamancers make simple requests: obey or die.

card.name: Moment's Peace
card.ability:
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
Flashback {2}{G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

card.name: Morbid Hunger
card.ability:
Morbid Hunger deals 3 damage to target creature or player. You gain 3 life.
Flashback {7}{B}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

card.name: Morgue Theft
card.ability:
Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
Flashback {4}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

card.name: Mortivore
card.ability:
Mortivore's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in all graveyards.
{B}: Regenerate Mortivore.

card.name: Mossfire Egg
card.ability: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Mossfire Egg: Add {R}{G} to your mana pool. Draw a card.
card.flavor:
"Can you feel your instincts overwhelm your reason?"
—Watnik, master glassblower
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : This is a mana ability, which means it can be activated as part of the process of casting a spell or activating another ability. If that happens you get the mana right away, but you don't get to look at the drawn card until you have finished casting that spell or activating that ability.

card.name: Mossfire Valley
card.ability: {1}, {T}: Add {R}{G} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Lush growth spreads like a ferocious blaze across the Otarian hillsides.

card.name: Mudhole
card.ability: Target player exiles all land cards from his or her graveyard.
card.flavor: "Doing okay back there, Tarv? Tarv?"

card.name: Muscle Burst
card.ability: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is 3 plus the number of cards named Muscle Burst in all graveyards.
card.flavor: As strong as a centaur's will.

card.name: Mystic Crusader
card.ability:
Protection from black and from red
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Mystic Crusader gets +1/+1 and has flying.

card.name: Mystic Enforcer
card.ability:
Protection from black
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Mystic Enforcer gets +3/+3 and has flying.

card.name: Mystic Penitent
card.ability:
Vigilance
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Mystic Penitent gets +1/+1 and has flying.

card.name: Mystic Visionary
card.ability: Threshold — Mystic Visionary has flying as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
card.flavor: "The aven are heralds of divinity. The greatest glory is to join them in the sky."

card.name: Mystic Zealot
card.ability: Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Mystic Zealot gets +1/+1 and has flying.
card.flavor: Nomad youths aspire to one of two roles in the tribe: priest or warrior. Their secret dream is to become both.

card.name: Nantuko Disciple
card.ability: {G}, {T}: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
Unanswered prayers are themselves answers.
—Nantuko teaching

card.name: Nantuko Elder
card.ability: {T}: Add {1}{G} to your mana pool.
card.flavor:
Plant a field with wishes, and you will grow more wishes.
—Nantuko teaching

card.name: Nantuko Mentor
card.ability: {2}{G}, {T}: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is that creature's power.
card.flavor:
That which grows without roots cannot be uprooted.
—Nantuko teaching
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The value of X is determined when the ability resolves. The value will not change over time.

card.name: Nantuko Shrine
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a spell, that player puts X 1/1 green Squirrel creature tokens onto the battlefield, where X is the number of cards in all graveyards with the same name as that spell.

card.name: Need for Speed
card.ability: Sacrifice a land: Target creature gains haste until end of turn.
card.flavor: His feet buckled the ground, his hands cut the wind to ribbons, and he was gone.

card.name: Nefarious Lich
card.ability:
If damage would be dealt to you, exile that many cards from your graveyard instead. If you can't, you lose the game.
If you would gain life, draw that many cards instead.
When Nefarious Lich leaves the battlefield, you lose the game.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If you were going to gain life and you also have a replacement that can turn card drawing into life gain on the battlefield, you can gain life by using the Lich to turn the original life gain into card drawing, and then using the other replacement to turn a card draw into life gain. Nefarious Lich will not replace the life gain with a card draw again because it has already acted on this event.
10/4/2004 : This card will not prevent you from losing the game due to zero or less life.

card.name: New Frontiers
card.ability: Each player may search his or her library for up to X basic land cards and put them onto the battlefield tapped. Then each player who searched his or her library this way shuffles it.
card.flavor: Spreading a blanket of growth to warm a weary world.

card.name: Nimble Mongoose
card.ability:
Shroud (This permanent can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Threshold — Nimble Mongoose gets +2/+2 as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
card.flavor: Faster than a cobra's bite.

card.name: Nomad Decoy
card.ability:
{W}, {T}: Tap target creature.
Threshold — {W}{W}, {T}: Tap two target creatures. Activate this ability only if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
card.flavor: If you can take something from a nomad, it's probably bait.

card.name: Nomad Stadium
card.ability:
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool. Nomad Stadium deals 1 damage to you.
Threshold — {W}, {T}, Sacrifice Nomad Stadium: You gain 4 life. Activate this ability only if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

card.name: Nut Collector
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a 1/1 green Squirrel creature token onto the battlefield.
Threshold — Squirrel creatures get +2/+2 as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

card.name: Obstinate Familiar
card.ability: If you would draw a card, you may skip that draw instead.
card.flavor:
"Lizards make excellent familiars. They never know when they've lost."
—Matoc, lavamancer

card.name: Otarian Juggernaut
card.ability:
Otarian Juggernaut can't be blocked by Walls.
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Otarian Juggernaut gets +3/+0 and attacks each turn if able.

card.name: Overeager Apprentice
card.ability: Discard a card, Sacrifice Overeager Apprentice: Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Slow and steady may not always win the race, but at least it doesn't end up splattered on the walls.

card.name: Overrun
card.ability: Creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.
card.flavor:
The dance of angry feet
—Nantuko expression meaning
"stampede"
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : Overrun affects only creatures you control at the time it resolves. It won't affect creatures that come under your control later in the turn.

card.name: Painbringer
card.ability: {T}, Exile any number of cards from your graveyard: Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the number of cards exiled this way.

card.name: Pardic Firecat
card.ability:
Haste
If Pardic Firecat is in a graveyard, effects from spells named Flame Burst count it as a card named Flame Burst.
card.flavor:
"I've heard of putting the cat out, but this isn't what I had in mind."
—Nomad sentry

card.name: Pardic Miner
card.ability: Sacrifice Pardic Miner: Target player can't play lands this turn.
card.flavor:
"Punch and drag,
Toss the slag,
Sift the soil,
Leave the spoil."
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The ability won't stop lands from being put onto the battlefield by a spell or ability.
10/4/2004 : The ability won't stop players from activating the abilities of lands. It only stops land cards from being played.

card.name: Pardic Swordsmith
card.ability: {R}, Discard a card at random: Pardic Swordsmith gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: A finely crafted blade will never meet as many blows on the battlefield as it did on the anvil.

card.name: Patchwork Gnomes
card.ability: Discard a card: Regenerate Patchwork Gnomes.
card.flavor: When building gnomes, dwarves adhere to the highest standards. The gnomes themselves aren't as particular.

card.name: Patriarch's Desire
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/-2.
Threshold — Enchanted creature gets an additional +2/-2 as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

card.name: Patrol Hound
card.ability: Discard a card: Patrol Hound gains first strike until end of turn.
card.flavor: To the camp, it was a fierce and loyal protector. To the sentry's youngest daughter, it would always be her "Wuv Muffin."

card.name: Patron Wizard
card.ability: Tap an untapped Wizard you control: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.
card.flavor: "The best way to teach is by example."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Since the cost does not include the {Tap} symbol, it can tap itself even on the turn it enters the battlefield.

card.name: Pedantic Learning
card.ability: Whenever a land card is put into your graveyard from your library, you may pay {1}. If you do, draw a card.
card.flavor: Even the trivial can inspire.

card.name: Peek
card.ability:
Look at target player's hand.
Draw a card.
card.flavor: Sometimes you have to read between the minds.

card.name: Persuasion
card.ability:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
You control enchanted creature.
card.flavor: "Protocol demands that you bow down before me. I always stand on protocol."

card.name: Petrified Field
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Petrified Field: Return target land card from your graveyard to your hand.

card.name: Phantatog
card.ability:
Sacrifice an enchantment: Phantatog gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Discard a card: Phantatog gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

card.name: Phantom Whelp
card.ability: When Phantom Whelp attacks or blocks, return it to its owner's hand at end of combat. (Return it only if it's on the battlefield.)
card.flavor: It lurks in the mist, waiting for stragglers to fall behind. When the fog clears, nothing remains but footprints.

card.name: Pianna, Nomad Captain
card.ability: Whenever Pianna, Nomad Captain attacks, attacking creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Some find inspiration in their swords. Others find it in their leaders.

card.name: Pilgrim of Justice
card.ability:
Protection from red
{W}, Sacrifice Pilgrim of Justice: The next time a red source of your choice would deal damage this turn, prevent that damage.
card.flavor: "I would die a thousand deaths before I let you harm another."

card.name: Pilgrim of Virtue
card.ability:
Protection from black
{W}, Sacrifice Pilgrim of Virtue: The next time a black source of your choice would deal damage this turn, prevent that damage.
card.flavor: "A life is measured by the lives it saves."

card.name: Piper's Melody
card.ability: Shuffle any number of target creature cards from your graveyard into your library.
card.flavor: Those who follow nature's path eventually walk in a circle.

card.name: Predict
card.ability: Name a card, then target player puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard. If that card is the named card, you draw two cards. Otherwise, you draw a card.

card.name: Price of Glory
card.ability: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, if it's not that player's turn, destroy that land.
card.flavor:
"True strength lies in action. Let the weak react to me."
—Kamahl, pit fighter

card.name: Primal Frenzy
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has trample.
card.flavor:
"Don't dismiss its anger as mindless fury. I assure you, it has purpose."
—Seton, centaur druid

card.name: Psionic Gift
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: This creature deals 1 damage to target creature or player."
card.flavor: For sale: Complete wizard's library. Rare scrolls, grimoires, and works of ancient spellcrafting Slightly abridged.

card.name: Psychatog
card.ability:
Discard a card: Psychatog gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Exile two cards from your graveyard: Psychatog gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

card.name: Pulsating Illusion
card.ability:
Flying
Discard a card: Pulsating Illusion gets +4/+4 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.

card.name: Puppeteer
card.ability: {U}, {T}: You may tap or untap target creature.
card.flavor: "Getting people to do what you want is merely a matter of telling them what they want to hear."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You decide on resolution whether or not to tap or untap the creature.

card.name: Rabid Elephant
card.ability: Whenever Rabid Elephant becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.
card.flavor: When in doubt, stomp.

card.name: Ravaged Highlands
card.ability:
Ravaged Highlands enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Ravaged Highlands: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

card.name: Ray of Distortion
card.ability:
Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
Flashback {4}{W}{W} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

card.name: Reckless Charge
card.ability:
Target creature gets +3/+0 and gains haste until end of turn.
Flashback {2}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

card.name: Recoup
card.ability:
Target sorcery card in your graveyard gains flashback until end of turn. The flashback cost is equal to its mana cost. (Mana cost includes color.)
Flashback {3}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : For split cards, you pay only the cost for the half of the card you are casting. This is true because the cost is not looked at until after the card is on the stack, at which time it only has one of the two costs.
10/4/2004 : For cards with an X (or Y) in the mana cost, you choose these values at the time you play the spell and your choice is used to set the mana cost that Flashback requires.
10/4/2004 : If the card already has a Flashback ability, a second Flashback ability is added. The card can be cast using either.
10/4/2004 : The mana cost for the card is determined at the time you would pay the cost. It is not frozen at an earlier time.

card.name: Refresh
card.ability:
Regenerate target creature.
Draw a card.
card.flavor:
Death is a moth that dances toward our inner flame. The brightest fire can singe its wings.
—Nantuko teaching

card.name: Repel
card.ability: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.
card.flavor:
"I have a hunch we'll be seeing that one again soon."
—Ambassador Laquatus

card.name: Repentant Vampire
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Repentant Vampire this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Repentant Vampire.
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Repentant Vampire is white and has "{T}: Destroy target black creature."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If Threshold is met, this card is white. It is not white and black.

card.name: Resilient Wanderer
card.ability:
First strike
Discard a card: Resilient Wanderer gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
card.flavor: Nomads understand many cultures and therefore travel without fear.

card.name: Rites of Initiation
card.ability: Discard any number of cards at random. Creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn for each card discarded this way.

card.name: Rites of Refusal
card.ability: Discard any number of cards. Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3} for each card discarded this way.

card.name: Rites of Spring
card.ability: Discard any number of cards. Search your library for up to that many basic land cards, reveal those cards, and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You can choose to find fewer basic land cards if you want to.

card.name: Roar of the Wurm
card.ability:
Put a 6/6 green Wurm creature token onto the battlefield.
Flashback {3}{G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

card.name: Rotting Giant
card.ability: Whenever Rotting Giant attacks or blocks, sacrifice it unless you exile a card from your graveyard.
card.flavor: Wracked with rot, it wrecks and ruins.

card.name: Sacred Rites
card.ability: Discard any number of cards. Creatures you control get +0/+1 until end of turn for each card discarded this way.

card.name: Sadistic Hypnotist
card.ability: Sacrifice a creature: Target player discards two cards. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
card.flavor: "Victory in the pits is almost as rewarding as the methods I use to achieve it."
card.ruling: 4/15/2013 : If you cast this as normal during your main phase, it will enter the battlefield and you'll receive priority. If no abilities trigger because of this, you can activate its ability immediately, before any other player has a chance to remove it from the battlefield.

card.name: Sandstone Deadfall
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice two lands and Sandstone Deadfall: Destroy target attacking creature.
card.flavor:
"Two or three tons of rock can really get you down—and keep you there."
—Kamahl, pit fighter

card.name: Sarcatog
card.ability:
Exile two cards from your graveyard: Sarcatog gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Sacrifice an artifact: Sarcatog gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

card.name: Savage Firecat
card.ability:
Trample
Savage Firecat enters the battlefield with seven +1/+1 counters on it.
Whenever you tap a land for mana, remove a +1/+1 counter from Savage Firecat.

card.name: Scorching Missile
card.ability:
Scorching Missile deals 4 damage to target player.
Flashback {9}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

card.name: Screams of the Damned
card.ability: {1}{B}, Exile a card from your graveyard: Screams of the Damned deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.
card.flavor: It's important to face your inner demons . . . unless they're the kind of demons that can kill you.

card.name: Scrivener
card.ability: When Scrivener enters the battlefield, you may return target instant card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: A good memory is no match for a good scribe.

card.name: Seafloor Debris
card.ability:
Seafloor Debris enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Seafloor Debris: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

card.name: Second Thoughts
card.ability:
Exile target attacking creature.
Draw a card.
card.flavor: It suddenly dawned on Jorin that farming was quite a noble profession.

card.name: Seize the Day
card.ability:
Untap target creature. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.
Flashback {2}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It only creates an additional combat and main phase if it resolves during a main phase.

card.name: Seton, Krosan Protector
card.ability: Tap an untapped Druid you control: Add {G} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: "Survival of the fittest is not only the law of the pits, it is the law of nature. That is why I fight."

card.name: Seton's Desire
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2.
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, all creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.

card.name: Shadowblood Egg
card.ability: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Shadowblood Egg: Add {B}{R} to your mana pool. Draw a card.
card.flavor:
"Does your passion for power consume your soul?"
—Watnik, master glassblower
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : This is a mana ability, which means it can be activated as part of the process of casting a spell or activating another ability. If that happens you get the mana right away, but you don't get to look at the drawn card until you have finished casting that spell or activating that ability.

card.name: Shadowblood Ridge
card.ability: {1}, {T}: Add {B}{R} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: The carnage of conflicts long past still stains the Otarian soil.

card.name: Shadowmage Infiltrator
card.ability:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
Whenever Shadowmage Infiltrator deals combat damage to a player, you may draw a card.

card.name: Shelter
card.ability:
Target creature you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
Draw a card.
card.flavor: Good strategists seize opportunities. Great strategists make their own.

card.name: Shifty Doppelganger
card.ability: {3}{U}, Exile Shifty Doppelganger: You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield. If you do, that creature gains haste until end of turn. At the beginning of the next end step, sacrifice that creature. If you do, return Shifty Doppelganger to the battlefield.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If the creature is not still on the battlefield at beginning of the End step, then you do not return this card to the battlefield.
8/1/2008 : This card has received errata such that putting a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield is now optional. This means you no longer need a third-party to verify that you don't have any creature cards in your hand if you don't put something onto the battlefield.

card.name: Shower of Coals
card.ability:
Shower of Coals deals 2 damage to each of up to three target creatures and/or players.
Threshold — Shower of Coals deals 4 damage to each of those creatures and/or players instead if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

card.name: Simplify
card.ability: Each player sacrifices an enchantment.
card.flavor:
A blossom's petals close inward to shut out the frost.
—Nantuko teaching

card.name: Skeletal Scrying
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Skeletal Scrying, exile X cards from your graveyard.
You draw X cards and you lose X life.

card.name: Skull Fracture
card.ability:
Target player discards a card.
Flashback {3}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

card.name: Skycloud Egg
card.ability: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Skycloud Egg: Add {W}{U} to your mana pool. Draw a card.
card.flavor:
"Have your dreams of a better society become an obsession?"
—Watnik, master glassblower
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : This is a mana ability, which means it can be activated as part of the process of casting a spell or activating another ability. If that happens you get the mana right away, but you don't get to look at the drawn card until you have finished casting that spell or activating that ability.

card.name: Skycloud Expanse
card.ability: {1}, {T}: Add {W}{U} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: From Otaria, the sun above meets the sea below at a glittering horizon.

card.name: Skyshooter
card.ability:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
{T}, Sacrifice Skyshooter: Destroy target attacking or blocking creature with flying.

card.name: Soulcatcher
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever a creature with flying dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Soulcatcher.
card.flavor:
"Holy couriers guide aven spirits up to the home of the Ancestor."
—Mystic elder

card.name: Spark Mage
card.ability: Whenever Spark Mage deals combat damage to a player, you may have Spark Mage deal 1 damage to target creature that player controls.
card.flavor: The Pardic Mountains are known for their spicy cuisine.

card.name: Spellbane Centaur
card.ability: Creatures you control can't be the targets of blue spells or abilities from blue sources.
card.flavor: "No mage's deception can harm those who keep nature balanced."

card.name: Sphere of Duty
card.ability: If a green source would deal damage to you, prevent 2 of that damage.
card.flavor: Duty subdues instinct.

card.name: Sphere of Grace
card.ability: If a black source would deal damage to you, prevent 2 of that damage.
card.flavor: Grace repels darkness.

card.name: Sphere of Law
card.ability: If a red source would deal damage to you, prevent 2 of that damage.
card.flavor: Law smothers anarchy.

card.name: Sphere of Reason
card.ability: If a blue source would deal damage to you, prevent 2 of that damage.
card.flavor: Reason exposes deception.

card.name: Sphere of Truth
card.ability: If a white source would deal damage to you, prevent 2 of that damage.
card.flavor: Truth tempers fanaticism.

card.name: Spiritualize
card.ability:
Until end of turn, whenever target creature deals damage, you gain that much life.
Draw a card.
card.flavor:
"There is purity in all things. Even hatred."
—Lieutenant Kirtar

card.name: Springing Tiger
card.ability: Threshold — Springing Tiger gets +2/+2 as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
card.flavor: The ground trembled in a violent purr.

card.name: Squirrel Mob
card.ability: Squirrel Mob gets +1/+1 for each other Squirrel on the battlefield.
card.flavor: An army of squirrels is still an army.

card.name: Squirrel Nest
card.ability:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{T}: Put a 1/1 green Squirrel creature token onto the battlefield."
card.flavor: In the Krosan Forest, you've got to keep an eye out for the squirrels.
card.ruling: 8/1/2005 : The land receives this ability and not the actual text. Text-changing effects can be used on this Aura, but would not change this effect if cast on the land.

card.name: Stalking Bloodsucker
card.ability:
Flying
{1}{B}, Discard a card: Stalking Bloodsucker gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
card.flavor: The pits feed both its thirst for combat and its thirst for blood.

card.name: Standstill
card.ability: When a player casts a spell, sacrifice Standstill. If you do, each of that player's opponents draws three cards.
card.flavor: "Take your time."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It only works once. If someone casts another spell after it triggers, but before that trigger resolves, then it will trigger again. The first time one of these triggers resolves, it will be sacrificed for the full effect. Any additional triggers on the stack will do nothing when they resolve because you will be unable to sacrifice it additional times.

card.name: Steam Vines
card.ability:
Enchant land
When enchanted land becomes tapped, destroy it and Steam Vines deals 1 damage to that land's controller. That player attaches Steam Vines to a land of his or her choice.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If this card leaves the battlefield after it triggers but before it resolves, then the trigger will deal damage and destroy the land, but it will not bring this card back to the battlefield.
10/4/2004 : Moving this card to another land does not target the land.
8/1/2005 : If there are no other lands to move it to, this card goes to the graveyard as would any Aura that lost the thing it enchants.

card.name: Steamclaw
card.ability:
{3}, {T}: Exile target card from a graveyard.
{1}, Sacrifice Steamclaw: Exile target card from a graveyard.
card.flavor:
"There's dead, and then there's dead dead."
—Steamclaw driver

card.name: Still Life
card.ability: {G}{G}: Still Life becomes a 4/3 Centaur creature until end of turn. It's still an enchantment.
card.flavor: The centaurs' simple magic can undo a basilisk's gaze, but only for a short time.
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.

card.name: Stone-Tongue Basilisk
card.ability:
Whenever Stone-Tongue Basilisk deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, all creatures able to block Stone-Tongue Basilisk do so.

card.name: Sungrass Egg
card.ability: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Sungrass Egg: Add {G}{W} to your mana pool. Draw a card.
card.flavor:
"Has your peaceful nature led you on a crusade?"
—Watnik, master glassblower
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : This is a mana ability, which means it can be activated as part of the process of casting a spell or activating another ability. If that happens you get the mana right away, but you don't get to look at the drawn card until you have finished casting that spell or activating that ability.

card.name: Sungrass Prairie
card.ability: {1}, {T}: Add {G}{W} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: On Otaria, peace and harmony are rare. Places that provide both are cherished.

card.name: Sylvan Might
card.ability:
Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains trample until end of turn.
Flashback {2}{G}{G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

card.name: Syncopate
card.ability: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. If that spell is countered this way, exile it instead of putting it into its owner's graveyard.
card.flavor:
"Memories can't simply be washed away. The mind must be scrubbed clean."
—Ambassador Laquatus

card.name: Tainted Pact
card.ability: Exile the top card of your library. You may put that card into your hand unless it has the same name as another card exiled this way. Repeat this process until you put a card into your hand or you exile two cards with the same name, whichever comes first.

card.name: Tarnished Citadel
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. Tarnished Citadel deals 3 damage to you.

card.name: Tattoo Ward
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has protection from enchantments. This effect doesn't remove Tattoo Ward.
Sacrifice Tattoo Ward: Destroy target enchantment.

card.name: Terravore
card.ability:
Trample
Terravore's power and toughness are each equal to the number of land cards in all graveyards.

card.name: Testament of Faith
card.ability: {X}: Testament of Faith becomes an X/X Wall creature with defender until end of turn. It's still an enchantment.
card.flavor:
"Belief in the Ancestor is admirable, but our enemies often demand something more . . . tangible."
—Pianna, nomad captain
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.

card.name: Thaumatog
card.ability:
Sacrifice a land: Thaumatog gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Sacrifice an enchantment: Thaumatog gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

card.name: Thermal Blast
card.ability:
Thermal Blast deals 3 damage to target creature.
Threshold — Thermal Blast deals 5 damage to that creature instead if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

card.name: Think Tank
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, look at the top card of your library. You may put that card into your graveyard.
card.flavor: Cephalids seek knowledge not to better themselves, but to best others.

card.name: Thought Devourer
card.ability:
Flying
Your maximum hand size is reduced by four.
card.flavor: Thinking is hard.
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : If multiple effects modify your hand size, apply them in timestamp order. For example, if you are affected by Cursed Rack (an artifact that sets a player's maximum hand size to four) and then put Thought Devourer onto the battlefield, your maximum hand size would be zero. However, if those permanents entered the battlefield in the opposite order, your maximum hand size would be four.

card.name: Thought Eater
card.ability:
Flying
Your maximum hand size is reduced by three.
card.flavor: The first memory it sucks out of its host is how to get rid of it.
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : If multiple effects modify your hand size, apply them in timestamp order. For example, if you are affected by Cursed Rack (an artifact that sets a player's maximum hand size to four) and then put Thought Eater onto the battlefield, your maximum hand size would be one. However, if those permanents entered the battlefield in the opposite order, your maximum hand size would be four.

card.name: Thought Nibbler
card.ability:
Flying
Your maximum hand size is reduced by two.
card.flavor: Balshan wizards have long used them to gnaw away the memories they wish to forget.
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : If multiple effects modify your hand size, apply them in timestamp order. For example, if you are affected by Cursed Rack (an artifact that sets a player's maximum hand size to four) and then put Thought Nibbler onto the battlefield, your maximum hand size would be two. However, if those permanents entered the battlefield in the opposite order, your maximum hand size would be four.

card.name: Timberland Ruins
card.ability:
Timberland Ruins enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Timberland Ruins: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

card.name: Time Stretch
