card.ability: Target player takes two extra turns after this one.
card.flavor: There's lots of time like the present.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If multiple "extra turn" effects resolve in the same turn, take them in the reverse of the order that the effects resolved.

card.name: Tireless Tribe
card.ability: Discard a card: Tireless Tribe gets +0/+4 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "We've survived starvation, dwarf attacks, and heatstroke. Why should a little sandstorm bother us?"

card.name: Tombfire
card.ability: Target player exiles all cards with flashback from his or her graveyard.
card.flavor: The fondest memories burn brightest. As they're lost forever, the flames grow hotter still.

card.name: Touch of Invisibility
card.ability:
Target creature is unblockable this turn.
Draw a card.
card.flavor: Cephalids specialize in things unseen, be they politics, betrayal, or themselves.

card.name: Traumatize
card.ability: Target player puts the top half of his or her library, rounded down, into his or her graveyard.
card.flavor: Dreads had half a mind to leave.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The player can put the cards in their graveyard in any order they choose.

card.name: Traveling Plague
card.ability:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of each upkeep, put a plague counter on Traveling Plague.
Enchanted creature gets -1/-1 for each plague counter on Traveling Plague.
When enchanted creature leaves the battlefield, that creature's controller returns Traveling Plague from its owner's graveyard to the battlefield.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : A counter is placed on every player's upkeep, not just the controller's upkeep.
10/4/2004 : The controller of the dead creature chooses the new creature.
8/1/2005 : When the enchanted creature leaves the battlefield, this card is placed into the graveyard as is normal for an Aura when it loses what it enchants. The triggered ability returns this card to the battlefield with no counters on it.
5/1/2006 : In Two-Headed Giant, triggers only once per upkeep, not once for each player.

card.name: Treetop Sentinel
card.ability: Flying, protection from green
card.flavor: Crian's patrols afford him plenty of opportunity to take potshots at the "dirtwalkers" far below.

card.name: Tremble
card.ability: Each player sacrifices a land.
card.flavor: Otaria's frequent tremors are the last stages of Dominaria's recovery from the Phyrexian war.

card.name: Twigwalker
card.ability: {1}{G}, Sacrifice Twigwalker: Two target creatures each get +2/+2 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Break one in half and you'll get a decent—if gooey—pair of weapons."
—Centaur warrior

card.name: Unifying Theory
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a spell, that player may pay {2}. If the player does, he or she draws a card.
card.flavor: Scribbles of a lunatic and formulas of a genius are often indistinguishable.

card.name: Upheaval
card.ability: Return all permanents to their owners' hands.
card.flavor: The calm comes after the storm.

card.name: Vampiric Dragon
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Vampiric Dragon this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Vampiric Dragon.
{1}{R}: Vampiric Dragon deals 1 damage to target creature.

card.name: Verdant Succession
card.ability: Whenever a green nontoken creature dies, that creature's controller may search his or her library for a card with the same name as that creature and put it onto the battlefield. If that player does, he or she shuffles his or her library.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You can choose not to find the card.
8/1/2008 : If the creature was only a creature as the result of an animation effect, its controller still gets to search for a card with the same name. For example, if an animated Still Life is put into a graveyard, its controller gets to search his or her library for a card named Still Life.

card.name: Vivify
card.ability:
Target land becomes a 3/3 creature until end of turn. It's still a land.
Draw a card.
card.flavor: Near the Krosan border, farmers keep watch over their fields lest the sod get up and wander away.
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.

card.name: Volcanic Spray
card.ability:
Volcanic Spray deals 1 damage to each creature without flying and each player.
Flashback {1}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

card.name: Volley of Boulders
card.ability:
Volley of Boulders deals 6 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.
Flashback {R}{R}{R}{R}{R}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You can't choose zero targets. You must choose between 1 and 6 targets.

card.name: Wayward Angel
card.ability:
Flying, vigilance
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Wayward Angel gets +3/+3, is black, has trample, and has "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : When you have seven or more cards in your graveyard, this card is black. It is not white and black.

card.name: Werebear
card.ability:
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
Threshold — Werebear gets +3/+3 as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
card.flavor: He exercises his right to bear arms.

card.name: Whipkeeper
card.ability: {T}: Whipkeeper deals damage to target creature equal to the damage already dealt to it this turn.
card.flavor: "If you don't hit your adversaries while they're down, they might get up again."
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If the creature regenerated during the turn, and thereby had all damage on it removed, the damage before it regenerated was still dealt that turn and will be counted.
10/4/2004 : This counts all damage that was dealt during the turn. This does not include any damage that was prevented.

card.name: Whispering Shade
card.ability:
Swampwalk
{B}: Whispering Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: It glides through the shadows until it reaches yours.

card.name: Wild Mongrel
card.ability: Discard a card: Wild Mongrel gets +1/+1 and becomes the color of your choice until end of turn.
card.flavor: It teaches you to play dead.

card.name: Woodland Druid
card.flavor:
What is a tree?
Slow hard thought.
What is a flower?
Swift soft flesh.
What is a druid?
Both.

card.name: Words of Wisdom
card.ability: You draw two cards, then each other player draws a card.
card.flavor: Knowledge can't be kept in a bottle or sealed in a box. It yearns to be spread and shared.

card.name: Zombie Assassin
card.ability: {T}, Exile two cards from your graveyard and Zombie Assassin: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
card.flavor:
"Zombies don't kill. They recruit."
—Braids, dementia summoner

card.name: Zombie Cannibal
card.ability: Whenever Zombie Cannibal deals combat damage to a player, you may exile target card from that player's graveyard.
card.flavor: Nothing is sacred to the undead—not even their own kind.

card.name: Zombie Infestation
card.ability: Discard two cards: Put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: The nomads' funeral pyres are more practical than ceremonial.

card.name: Zombify
card.ability: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
card.flavor:
"The first birth celebrates life. The second birth mocks it."
—Mystic elder

card.name: Zoologist
card.ability: {3}{G}, {T}: Reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card, put it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, put it into your graveyard.
card.flavor: "With friends like these, who needs people?"
